intro: Spermacoce globosa, commonly known as the globe sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Spermacoce globosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
